docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 19.--According to newspapers here six British cruisers have left the Falkland Island's in search of the German raider and to protect the shipping lane. The raider is believed here to be receiving wireless information from a...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 19.--According to newspapers here six British cruisers have left the Falkland Island's in search of the German raider and to protect the shipping lane. The raider is believed here to be receiving wireless information from a Brazilian island.
docs.abstract: 6 British cruisers leave Falkland Islands for South Atlantic

headline.main: BRITISH CRUISERS OUT ON TRAIL OF RAIDER; Six Leave Falkland Islands to Take Up Search;-Suspect Secret Wireless Plant. ALARM IN WEST INDIES. Residents of British and French Ports Fear a Raid by Germans. PROOF OF TWO RAIDERS. Shipping Men Say Area of Operations Is Too Great for One. DEMANDS RUTHLESS WAR. We Fear God and Nothing Else, Including America, Says Baron.
COURT CALENDARS; CASES WILL BE CALLED IN THE ORDER GIVEN BELOW. (<) This character means versus or against.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 22.--Unverified reports were received today in maritime circles at Montevideo, Uruguay, that the German cruiser Vineta, [said to be the commerce raider,] had been sighted at sea off Bahia Blanca, Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 22.--Unverified reports were received today in maritime circles at Montevideo, Uruguay, that the German cruiser Vineta, [said to be the commerce raider,] had been sighted at sea off Bahia Blanca, Argentina.
docs.abstract: German cruiser Vineta reported sighted off Bahia Bianca, Argentina; report that British cruiser Glasgow has sunk raider off Para; reports with regard to escape of German sailors from gunboat Eber denied by Brazil officials; 2 British submarines arrive from Halifax to hunt raider; 6 British cruisers, 2 Italian and 4 French join chase; Capt. Persius quoted on raider; Lieut. Badewitz interviewed

headline.main: RAIDER SIGHTED OFF SOUTH COAST OF ARGENTINA; Montevideo Hears That German Cruiser Vineta Was Seen Near Bahia Blanca. NOT SUNK, RIO DECLARES No Confirmation There of Destruction of Vessel by British Warship Glasgow.SUBMARINES JOIN SEARCH Two Big Boats from Halifax Stop at Bermuda on Their Way South.

docs.snippet: MADRID, Feb. 4, (via Paris.)--King Alfonso and Queen Victoria attended the opera last night, leaving at midnight. The King then received Count de Romanones, Premier and Minister of Foreign Affairs, at the palace, where they conferred well into the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MADRID, Feb. 4, (via Paris.)--King Alfonso and Queen Victoria attended the opera last night, leaving at midnight. The King then received Count de Romanones, Premier and Minister of Foreign Affairs, at the palace, where they conferred well into the morning.
docs.abstract: King Alfonso discusses Spanish reply to submarine note with his Ministers

headline.main: SPAIN TO REJECT NOTE; Will Reply to Germany With Strong Protest to Be Made Public Today. KING IN NIGHT CONFERENCE Germany's Ruthless U-Boat Plans to be Repudiated as Violation of International Law. BRAZIL'S PROTEST FORECAST Inspired Rio Newspaper Hints at Note to Berlin Indorsing President Wilson's Action. BRAZIL IS EXPECTED TO APPROVE OUR ACTION Inspired Newspaper Hints at a Note to Berlin Aligning Rio With Washington. Brazil's Case That of America. SPAIN MAY SEND NOTE OF PROTEST TO BERLIN "Brazil Has Been Directly Touched." Calls for Pan American Action. Brazilian Protest to Germany? SOUTH AMERICAN APPROVAL. Some Newspapers Do Not Believe War Will Follow the Break. CHILE STANDS WITH US. Aloofness Impossible Now, Says a Leading Paper. EXCITEMENT IN HOLLAND. Action of United States Expected to Influence Government's Course. NORTHERN NEUTRALS CONFER. Sweden, Norway, and Denmark Exchanging Views on German Note. SEEKS TO PLACATE NEUTRALS.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 6.--The Jornal do Commercio will publish Brazil's note to Germany tomorrow, apparently having received it from an official source.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 6.--The Jornal do Commercio will publish Brazil's note to Germany tomorrow, apparently having received it from an official source.
docs.abstract: forecast of note; Dr. L. Muller says that Pres. Braz does not consider intervention expedient; Naval Minister reports on situation; military measures relating to neutrality adopted; Govt. orders closing of Brazilian ports

headline.main: BRAZIL'S NOTE SEEKS TO AVOID IRRITATION; Government, However, Will Stand Firmly for Its Rights;-Argentina to Remain Passive.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE HAGUE, Feb. 6.--Premier Cort van der Linden made the following statement in the Second Chamber of the Dutch Parliament today:
docs.abstract: Russian, Greek, and Italian press comment on breach

headline.main: HOLLAND TO TAKE TIME TO CONSIDER SITUATION; No Reason at This Moment for Special Anxiety, the Premier Tells Parliament. President Wilson Criticised. Holland Stops Traffic with England. Germans Mass on Dutch Frontier. APPEALS AGAINST BLOCKADE. Holland Asks Britain and Germany to Let Her Ships Through. FEAR WILSON'S PEACE VIEWS. Some Russians Think His Influence in Negotiations Will Not Be Welcome TO INSURE FOREIGN SHIPS. Sweden Adopting Measures to Encourage Imports. ATHENS GREATLY EXCITED. Some Papers See in Our Move Cutting Off Their Food Supplies. ROME LOOKS TO NEUTRALS. Hopes Others Will Follow the Example of the United States. POPE MAKES PROTEST. Peter's Pence from America Expected to be Curtailed by Blockade. SWISS ANSWER NEGATIVE? Council's Reply to President Wilson Wired to Washington.
